clues.text:
On a tombstone:
RIP

A political group:
GOP

Found in some Catholic churches:
Msgr

On a college degree:
MFA

Found in some Chinese food:
MSG
A flat, thin metal ring used between a bolt & a nut to increase tightness
I've got a latch, now I need this part that rhymes with "latch" to hold it in place
Emery wheel is another name for this circular sharpening device
It's not a snare, it's the s-shaped section of pipe under a sink that seals off sewer gases
Hyphenated brand name for locking pliers that hold what is being worked on in place
Simaquarium is a great one of these for your monitor when you go AFK
As its name implies, W2mate 2008 from Real Business Solutions aids those trying to prepare these
Browsers are software too, like this bushy-tailed hottie from Mozilla
Symantec has a popular line of anti-virus software named for this man, first name Peter
It's hard being an "angel" when playing the PC version of this first-person shooter, dubbed "combat evolved"
Life becomes a jungle in his 1900 work "Lord Jim"
This future state became a possession in 1898 & a territory in 1900
His "Interpretation of Dreams" went from a vision to a reality
2 years after imposing martial law, King Umberto I of this country was assassinated by an anarchist
A constant is named for this physicist who in 1900 postulated that energy is radiated in quanta
"Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of _____, I will fear no evil"
"Glory, glory hallelujah, his _____ is marching on"
"Four score & 7 years ago our fathers brought forth, upon this continent, a new nation, conceived in _____"
"A well regulated ____, being necessary to the security of a free state"
" _____ is one percent inspiration & 99 percent perspiration"
Risque D.H. Lawrence novel
Edgar Rice Burroughs pulp novel about a lost world of dinosaurs
Romantic Sir Walter Scott poem about a gal on an island in Loch Katrine
Edward Bulwer-Lytton novel about the eruption of Vesuvius
Creepy Bram Stoker novel about a big pale snake

In German
In French
In Japanese
In Russian
In Romania, this Nicole Kidman film was called "What New Magic Tricks My Wife Did"
Michael J. Fox voiced this "Smart Little Mouse" in China & " "Naughty Mouse" in Egypt
This Adam Sandler football film was "Crazy Match in Prison" in Hong Kong; in Sweden, "Bonesquashing Mob -- Crush 'Em"
Switzerland messed with this Adam Sandler title, calling it "For Your Hair Only"; Spain had a "License to Comb"
Folks in Greece know this Eddie Murphy film as "Daddies as Nannies"
In prehistoric times 10 foot tall "terror birds" ranged over much of this continent, including Patagonia
The shamainu or Honshu type of this canine, died out early in the 20th century
Though specimens still exist in zoos, the Barbary lion, native to the north of this continent, is extinct in the wild
The Xerces Blue of this insect, native to sand dunes in San Francisco's Sunset District, became extinct in the 1940s
The bulldog rat disappeared around 1900 from this Aussie-owned island named for a holiday

Sir John,
Aretha

Oscar,
Square Garden

Robert H.,
Stonewall

Ethan,
Paul,
Woody

Ex-Senator Chafee,
Senator Blanche,
Tunnel
An infant's knitted or crocheted sock worn as an indoor shoe
Also called zoris, they're backless rubber sandals with a thong between the first 2 toes
Used in fishing and hunting, they're named for the activity of walking into water
A wooden shoe traditionally worn in Holland
Casual slip-on shoes with flaps on the front of the tongues sometimes used to hold a coin

rounds.comments: (Alex: We'll break down each response for you within the clue itself.)

clues.text: My 1-2-3 letter is the stone of a fruit & my 4-5-6-7 is a season
My 1-2-3 is a basenji or borzoi and my 4-5-6-7-8-9-10 was Mike Piazza's position
My 1-2-3-4-5 was British host David & my 6-7-8-9 means "to wound with the teeth"
My 1-2-3-4 is what a bad golfer yells & my 5-6-7-8-9-10 follows him on a sunny day
My 1-2-3 is active hostility between nations & my 4-5-6-7 is a gated chamber in a canal or dam

rounds.text: In 1604, for a special project, he approved a list of scholars to work at Westminster, Cambridge & Oxford
